page.title: 11A TYPICAL ST.WENN HEDGE
page.content: Across the road from{St.Wenn school is an old hedge. The hedge is four hundred years old.We can tell how old the hedge is by counting the frequency of species over a set distance. The sort of{flowers}that grow in the hedges are pink campion, buttercups, bluebells and violets.They are mainly wild flowers. The{trees}that are in St.Wenn hedges grow quite tall but they are often rotten.The sort of trees that are in the hedges are{thorn,holly,ash and {scyamore.}When the cutter comes it cuts some trees down.The cut branches are laid along the hedge tops. Thistles abound in the hedges as do ferns and bracken. The creatures that live in hedges are insects, mammals and birds.The sort of micro-life are those commonly found including snails, froghoppers,ladybirds and beetles.
